name: UISearchDisplayController
desc: Important: UISearchDisplayController is deprecated in iOS 8. (Note that UISearchDisplayDelegate is also deprecated.) To manage the presentation of a search bar and display search results in iOS 8 and later, instead use UISearchController.

items.name: init(searchBar: UISearchBar, contentsController: UIViewController)
items.desc: Returns a display controller initialized with the given search bar and contents controller.

items.name: var isActive: Bool
items.desc: The visibility state of the search interface.

items.name: func setActive(Bool, animated: Bool)
items.desc: Displays or hides the search interface, optionally with animation.

items.name: var searchContentsController: UIViewController
items.desc: The view controller that manages the contents being searched.

items.name: var searchResultsTableView: UITableView
items.desc: The table view in which the search results are displayed.

items.name: var searchResultsDataSource: UITableViewDataSource?
items.desc: The data source for the table view in which the search results are displayed.

items.name: var searchResultsDelegate: UITableViewDelegate?
items.desc: The delegate for the table view in which the search results are displayed.

items.name: var searchResultsTitle: String?
items.desc: The title for the search results view.

items.name: var displaysSearchBarInNavigationBar: Bool
items.desc: Specifies that the navigation bar contains a search bar.

items.name: var navigationItem: UINavigationItem?
items.desc: Represents the search display controller in a navigation controller’s navigation bar.
